article.title: Massive neutron stars and $Λ$-hypernuclei in relativistic mean field models

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares the predicted single-Λ binding energies of Λ-hypernuclei from two models (PK1 and TM1) to experimental data. Which of the following statements is TRUE based on the figure?
choices: The TM1 model consistently predicts higher binding energies than the PK1 model across all mass numbers.
Both models generally reproduce the experimental trend of increasing binding energy with increasing mass number.
The PK1 model provides a better fit to the experimental data for light hypernuclei (A < 50).
There is a significant discrepancy between theoretical predictions and experimental data for heavy hypernuclei (A > 150).

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the mean field potential and single-particle levels of Λ in 165Pb for different Λ-meson couplings. What is the MAIN conclusion drawn from this figure?
choices: The depth of the Λ potential well remains almost constant regardless of the specific values of ασλ and αωλ.
The single-particle levels of Λ are highly sensitive to variations in the coupling constant αωλ.
Increasing the value of αωλ results in a shallower Λ potential well.
The TM1 interaction predicts a significantly deeper Λ potential well compared to the PK1 interaction.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays the particle fractions of baryons and leptons in neutron star matter as a function of baryon number density. What does the shaded region in each panel represent?
choices: Variation in the results due to different values of the coupling constant αωλ.
Uncertainty in the calculations arising from the choice of nuclear effective interaction (PK1 or TM1).
The range of densities where a mixed phase of nuclear and hyperonic matter exists.
The impact of including different types of hyperons (Λ, Σ, Ξ) in the calculation.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure presents the pressure of neutron star matter as a function of energy density, comparing cases with and without Λ-hyperons. What is the PRIMARY effect of including Λ-hyperons on the equation of state (EoS)?
choices: The EoS becomes significantly stiffer at all densities.
The pressure increases more rapidly at low densities but plateaus at high densities.
The EoS softens, particularly at densities above the onset of Λ-hyperon appearance.
The inclusion of Λ-hyperons has a negligible effect on the overall EoS.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the mass-radius relations of neutron stars, considering the possible existence of Λ-hyperons and employing different values of αωλ.  What can be concluded from the figure regarding the "Hyperon Puzzle"?
choices: The inclusion of Λ-hyperons with the standard value of αωλ = 0.666 resolves the Hyperon Puzzle.
The Hyperon Puzzle persists even when varying αωλ within a reasonable range.
Increasing αωλ to values slightly higher than the naive quark model prediction allows the models to reproduce the observed masses of massive pulsars.
The figure demonstrates that Λ-hyperons play a negligible role in determining the maximum mass of neutron stars.
